text: My code hangs when I try to load one of my modules.  What’s the problem?

elements.text: My code hangs when I try to load one of my modules.  What’s the problem?

text: hard to tell without looking at the code.  what is hanging: package precompilation or loading of a precompiled module?  how long is the wait?  few seconds?  minutes?  hours?  (the last two are _unlikely_).  a random guess about the cause: heavy bad invalidations, it'd be a hint that you're doing something wrong.  also, what versions of julia?  latest versions are getting better and better at improving code loading time.

elements.text: hard to tell without looking at the code.  what is hanging: package precompilation or loading of a precompiled module?  how long is the wait?  few seconds?  minutes?  hours?  (the last two are

text: Thanks for replying!  I wish I knew whether precompilation or loading were hanging, but the wait is hours.  The REPL just sits there. :(

elements.text: Thanks for replying!  I wish I knew whether precompilation or loading were hanging, but the wait is hours.  The REPL just sits there. :(

text: the wait of hours is definitely wrong

How can I debug it?

text: <@UDB26738Q> I’ve fiddled with my code and discovered that just loading the module takes a few extra seconds but works.  Now, I’ll try calling it.

text:
sorry, but I'm not here to give private support.  besides, I don't have the time

I'd recommend you to reduce your code to generate a minimal working example (<https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example>), that's usually 70% to understand what's going on.  if you're still in trouble, ask on a slack (preferably out of this thread, I guess not many people are following it at this point)/on discuourse/any other of the public resource
